<<<<<<< HEAD
Origens repentance: after he had sacrificed to the idols of the heathen Gathered from Suidas, Nicephorus, Osiander, and the Greeke and Latine coppies in Origens workes; illustrated and applied to the case of euery poore penitent ... Diuided into three sections: containing 1 Origens fearefull fall. 2 His behauiour in it. 3 His worthy and sound conuersion. Together with Origens life and death, and other materiall obseruations. Written by Stephen Ierom, Master of Arts, and preacher of the towne of Newcastle; first for his owne exercise, and now published for the good of others. Jerome, Stephen, fl. 1604-1650.
[20], 63, [1] p.
By Iohn Beale, for Roger Iackson, and are to be sold at his shop neere Fleet-Conduit, Printed at London : 1619.
In verse. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Origens repentance: after he had sacrificed to the idols of the heathen Gathered from Suidas, Nicephorus, Osiander, and the Greeke and Latine coppies in Origens workes; illustrated and applied to the case of euery poore penitent ... Diuided into three sections: containing 1 Origens fearefull fall. 2 His behauiour in it. 3 His worthy and sound conuersion. Together with Origens life and death, and other materiall obseruations. Written by Stephen Ierom, Master of Arts, and preacher of the towne of Newcastle; first for his owne exercise, and now published for the good of others. Jerome, Stephen, fl. 1604-1650.
[20], 63, [1] p.
By Iohn Beale, for Roger Iackson, and are to be sold at his shop neere Fleet-Conduit, Printed at London : 1619.
In verse. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Roger Iackson
Iohn Beale
his shop neere Fleet-Conduit
